messages.page_content:
- Topic: Roll Call and Quorum Establishment
- Summary: The roll call was conducted to establish the presence of council members, and seven members were confirmed to be present, constituting a quorum.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Quorum was established for the council meeting.
- Tags/Keywords: Roll Call, Quorum, Council Members
- UID: 5bdb280b-e2f9-40a5-9b77-7c7f5f75b309

- Topic: Potential Reconsideration of Motion No. M-21-169
- Summary: The ordinance proposed amending City Council Rule 56 in its entirety to address meeting procedures considering COVID-19. The motion to suspend the rules and reconsider Motion No. M-21-169 was passed with 7 YEAS and 0 NAYS.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-169
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: The motion to suspend the rules and reconsider Motion No. M-21-169 was passed.
- Tags/Keywords: City Council, Rule Amendment, COVID-19, Motion
- UID: 9ab4f157-daa9-4357-b456-5370f7d51a15

- Topic: Adoption of Official Meeting Rules for May 20, 2021 Regular Council Meeting
- Summary: The council adopted procedures outlined in Attachment A relative to the official meeting rules for the May 20, 2021 Regular Council Meeting. All Special Orders are temporarily postponed due to the COVID-19 pandemic.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-176
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Adopt - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Adoption of official meeting rules and postponement of Special Orders due to COVID-19 pandemic.
- Tags/Keywords: Meeting Rules, Special Orders, COVID-19
- UID: 9bd2dad4-7eea-401e-8750-c1819570e76c

- Topic: Communications related to electric and gas utility matters
- Summary: Erin Spears, Chief of Staff & Counsel, Council Utilities Regulatory Office, submitted communications related to electric and gas utility matters to be received by the Council of the City of New Orleans. This included submissions by Entergy New Orleans, LLC and a petition for intervention by the Alliance for Affordable Energy.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Communications were submitted for the Council's review and consideration.
- Tags/Keywords: Electric utility, gas utility, communications, Entergy New Orleans, Alliance for Affordable Energy
- UID: fb9b92d8-3661-4968-9dde-ba255ed4985e

- Topic: Owner/applicant's response to VCC appeal report
- Summary: D. Alex Onstott, Member, Ciolino & Onstott, LLC, and Paul Valteau, Jr., Esq., submitted the owner/applicant's response to the VCC appeal report detailing the Commission's reversal.
- Ordinance Number: N/A
- Votes Summary:
    - Vote 1: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: The response was submitted for the Council's review and consideration.
- Tags/Keywords: VCC appeal report, owner/applicant response, Commission reversal
- UID: fb9b92d8-3661-4968-9dde-ba255ed4985e

- Topic: Allocation of Funds for Police Department
- Summary: The City Council approved an ordinance to transfer funds from the French Quarter Improvement Fund to the Department of Police to fund a Sergeant position and purchase vehicles for expanded patrols within the 8th District.
- Ordinance Number: 33,296
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Approved - (Number of YEAS, Number of NAYS, Number of ABSTAIN, Number of ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Allocation of funds for police department purposes
- Tags/Keywords: Fund transfer, Police Department, French Quarter Improvement Fund
- UID: 39b1b4ee-bb79-482b-b9c9-7a4cdd1e8175

- Topic: Property Disposition in Third Municipal District
- Summary: The City Council approved an ordinance for the disposition of immovable property consisting of an undesignated lot in the Third Municipal District.
- Ordinance Number: 33,297
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Approved - (Number of YEAS, Number of NAYS, Number of ABSTAIN, Number of ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Approval of property disposition
- Tags/Keywords: Property Disposition, Third Municipal District
- UID: 39b1b4ee-bb79-482b-b9c9-7a4cdd1e8175

- Topic: Funding for New Orleans City Seats Program
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to transfer funds from the Chief Administrative Office and Miscellaneous Program General Fund to the Mayor’s Office of Youth & Families to fund 100 seats to the New Orleans City Seats Program, providing high-quality child care to low-income families with children ages 0-2 years. The ordinance was recommended for approval by the Budget Committee and was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33297 - 28673 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (8 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Approved the transfer of funds to support the New Orleans City Seats Program.
- Tags/Keywords: New Orleans City Seats Program, child care, funding, Budget Committee
- UID: b353da59-2f5b-464d-bbd3-15aeb2f3b1f6

- Topic: Retail Sale of Packaged Alcoholic Beverages
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to establish a conditional use to permit the retail sale of packaged alcoholic beverages in an MU-2 High Intensity Mixed-Use District. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33298 - 28674 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 1 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Approved the conditional use for the retail sale of packaged alcoholic beverages in the specified district.
- Tags/Keywords: Alcoholic beverages, retail sale, conditional use, zoning
- UID: b353da59-2f5b-464d-bbd3-15aeb2f3b1f6

- Topic: Hotel with Live Entertainment in Design Overlay Districts
- Summary: The ordinance aimed to establish a conditional use to permit a hotel with live entertainment as a secondary use in specified districts. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33299 - 28675 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (7 YEAS, 1 NAYS, 1 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Approved the conditional use for the hotel with live entertainment in the designated districts.
- Tags/Keywords: Hotel, live entertainment, conditional use, zoning, design overlay districts
- UID: b353da59-2f5b-464d-bbd3-15aeb2f3b1f6

- Topic: Establishment of Algiers Riverfront Overlay District
- Summary: The ordinance aims to establish the Algiers Riverfront Overlay District to ensure that certain uses and designs are compatible with and preserve the character and integrity of Algiers. It also includes rezoning of certain areas and applies to all lots within specific boundaries. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33,300
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning, Algiers Riverfront, Rezoning
- UID: 7f5af7ab-eb40-4898-83d2-938ac71bf1d6

- Topic: Amendment to Permit Fast Food Restaurant with Drive-Thru Facilities
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to grant an amendment to permit a fast food restaurant with drive-thru facilities in specific commercial and overlay districts. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33,301
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Zoning Amendment, Fast Food Restaurant, Drive-Thru Facilities
- UID: 7f5af7ab-eb40-4898-83d2-938ac71bf1d6

- Topic: Appropriation of State Grant Funds for 2021 Operating Budget
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend the 2021 operating budget to appropriate state grant funds awarded by the Louisiana Commission on Law Enforcement. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33,307
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted without amendments.
- Tags/Keywords: Budget Amendment, State Grant Funds, Operating Budget
- UID: 7f5af7ab-eb40-4898-83d2-938ac71bf1d6

- Topic: Appropriation of state grant funds for protective supplies for the New Orleans Police Department’s Crime Lab personnel
- Summary: The ordinance aims to appropriate state grant funds awarded by the Louisiana Commission on Law Enforcement to the New Orleans Police Department’s Crime Lab for the purchase of protective and preventative supplies to safeguard personnel working on crime scenes and in COVID-19 pandemic environments. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33,308
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, allowing the appropriation of state grant funds for protective supplies for the Crime Lab personnel.
- Tags/Keywords: State grant funds, New Orleans Police Department, Crime Lab, protective supplies
- UID: bc10e70c-3648-4fc0-ab81-1ab3eead4847

- Topic: Utilization of state grant funds for officer overtime in the New Orleans Police Department
- Summary: This ordinance aims to amend the operating budget of revenues for the City of New Orleans to appropriate state grant funds awarded by the Louisiana Commission on Law Enforcement to the New Orleans Police Department. The funds will be utilized for officer overtime to assist police with conducting increased sex offender compliance checks and tracking the number of domestic violence follow-up investigations. The ordinance was adopted.
- Ordinance Number: 33,309
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted, allowing the utilization of state grant funds for officer overtime in the New Orleans Police Department for specific purposes.
- Tags/Keywords: State grant funds, New Orleans Police Department, officer overtime, sex offender compliance checks, domestic violence investigations
- UID: bc10e70c-3648-4fc0-ab81-1ab3eead4847

- Topic: State grant funds for increased police operations and domestic violence investigations
- Summary: The ordinance aims to appropriate state grant funds to the New Orleans Police Department for officer overtime to conduct increased sex offender compliance checks and track domestic violence follow-up investigations.
- Ordinance Number: 33310 - 28682 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (Unanimous)
- Decision/Key Actions: Appropriation of state grant funds for police operations
- Tags/Keywords: State grant funds, police operations, domestic violence, ordinance
- UID: af6415c0-07d5-422e-aabf-8034c1350c5e

- Topic: Appropriation of FY 2018 Family Recovery Collaborative grant funds
- Summary: The ordinance seeks to appropriate grant funds from the Department of Justice to assist mothers in the New Orleans area with opioid addiction.
- Ordinance Number: 33311 - 28683 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Passed - (Unanimous)
- Decision/Key Actions: Appropriation of grant funds for opioid addiction assistance
- Tags/Keywords: Grant funds, opioid addiction, Department of Justice, ordinance
- UID: af6415c0-07d5-422e-aabf-8034c1350c5e

- Topic: Appropriation of FY 2018 Family Recovery Collaborative grant funds
- Summary: This ordinance aims to appropriate grant funds awarded by the Federal Department of Justice to assist mothers in the New Orleans area with opioid addiction.

- Votes Summary:

- UID: af6415c0-07d5-422e-aabf-8034c1350c5e

- Topic: Appropriation of American Rescue Act grant funds for COVID-19 vaccines
- Summary: The ordinance aims to appropriate grant funds awarded by the Federal Department of Health and Human Services to the New Orleans Department of Health for COVID-19 vaccine-related activities. The funds will assist in planning, preparing, and executing vaccine-related activities to mitigate the spread of COVID-19.
- Ordinance Number: 33312 - 28684 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: ADOPTED - (N/A - Budget Committee recommended approval)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: American Rescue Act, grant funds, COVID-19 vaccines
- UID: fe972f8e-50be-4da6-823c-db845e6c6725

- Topic: Appropriation of American Rescue Act grant funds for COVID-19 vaccines
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to appropriate grant funds awarded by the Federal Department of Health and Human Services to the New Orleans Department of Health for the administration and tracking of COVID-19 vaccines. The funds will support planning, preparing, and executing vaccine-related activities to mitigate the spread of COVID-19.
- Ordinance Number: 33313 - 28685 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: ADOPTED - (N/A - Budget Committee recommended approval)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: American Rescue Act, grant funds, COVID-19 vaccines
- UID: fe972f8e-50be-4da6-823c-db845e6c6725

- Topic: Appropriation of state grant funds for public safety personnel training and equipment
- Summary: This ordinance aims to appropriate state grant funds to the Office of Homeland Security for training and equipment for public safety personnel. The funds are from the FY2020 State Homeland Security Program and will support public safety personnel in relation to homeland security.
- Ordinance Number: 33314 - 28686 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: ADOPTED - (N/A - Budget Committee recommended approval)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted.
- Tags/Keywords: state grant funds, public safety personnel, training, equipment
- UID: fe972f8e-50be-4da6-823c-db845e6c6725

- Topic: State Grant Funds for Disaster and Emergency Training
- Summary: The ordinance seeks to appropriate state grant funds to the Office of Homeland Security for training and equipment for public safety personnel in relation to disasters and emergencies.
- Ordinance Number: 33315 - 28687 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: ADOPTED - (N/A, N/A, N/A, N/A)
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was adopted without any notable amendments or discussions.
- Tags/Keywords: State grant funds, disaster training, emergency equipment
- UID: 0931f7d4-a65d-4ab0-8358-d208ff53ce61

- Topic: Economic Development Fund Transfer
- Summary: This ordinance aims to transfer funds from the Economic Development Fund to the Mayor’s Office of Economic Development to support the City’s economic development initiatives.
- Ordinance Number: 33316 - 28688 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:

- Topic: Operating Budget Amendments
- Summary: This ordinance seeks to amend the operating budget of expenditures for the City of New Orleans to appropriate state grant funds to the Office of Homeland Security and transfer funds from the Economic Development Fund to support economic development initiatives.
- Ordinance Number: 33317 - 28689 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:

- Summary: An ordinance to amend the 2021 Capital Budget by appropriating funds to the Department of Public Works.
- Ordinance Number: 33,319
- Votes Summary:

- Topic: Amendment to Building Code for Inspection Requirements
- Summary: The ordinance aims to amend the Building Code to require video or photographic inspections of public infrastructure before the issuance of building permits or Certificates of Occupancy. It also assigns responsibility for any identified damage. The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 6/3/21.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,302
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Continued to the meeting of 6/3/21
- Decision/Key Actions: Continued to the meeting of 6/3/21
- Tags/Keywords: Building Code, Inspection, Public Infrastructure
- UID: 50abdead-a970-419a-8e66-f6ab61feaa0a

- Topic: Amendment to Towing Allocation Program
- Summary: This ordinance aims to amend the City's towing allocation list procedures, removing the use of tow zones and establishing revised procedures, fees, penalties, and other requirements. The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 6/3/21.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,303
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Continued to the meeting of 6/3/21
- Decision/Key Actions: Continued to the meeting of 6/3/21
- Tags/Keywords: Towing, Allocation Program, Fees, Penalties
- UID: 50abdead-a970-419a-8e66-f6ab61feaa0a

- Topic: Regulation of Pedal Carriages
- Summary: The ordinance aims to define "pedal carriages" and forbid their operation or offering of transportation for hire within the City of New Orleans. The ordinance was referred to the Transportation Committee.
- Ordinance Number: CAL. NO. 33,304
- Votes Summary:
  Vote 1: Referred to the Transportation Committee
- Decision/Key Actions: Referred to the Transportation Committee
- Tags/Keywords: Pedal Carriages, Transportation, Regulation
- UID: 50abdead-a970-419a-8e66-f6ab61feaa0a

- Topic: Amendment to Ban on Pedal Carriages
- Summary: The amendment proposed adding a new section allowing the Council to reconsider the ban on pedal carriages and permit their operation by ordinance, subject to appropriate regulations.
- Ordinance Number: 33304-28678 M.C.S.
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Amendment - Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
    Vote 2: As Amended - Passed - (7 YEAS, 0 NAYS, 0 ABSTAIN, 0 ABSENT)
- Decision/Key Actions: Amendment to allow reconsideration of the ban on pedal carriages passed unanimously.
- Tags/Keywords: Amendment, Pedal Carriages, Regulations
- UID: 12af810e-958c-46a9-a979-5dc679b13593

- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for Municipal Yacht Harbor
- Summary: The ordinance authorized the Mayor to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement for repairing and reconstructing the Municipal Yacht Harbor in New Orleans.
- Ordinance Number: 33304-28678 AS AMENDED
- Votes Summary: N/A
- Decision/Key Actions: Authorization for the Cooperative Endeavor Agreement was granted.
- Tags/Keywords: Yacht Harbor, Cooperative Endeavor Agreement
- UID: 12af810e-958c-46a9-a979-5dc679b13593

- Topic: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with Jefferson Parish Sheriff’s Office
- Summary: The ordinance authorizes the Mayor of New Orleans to enter into a Cooperative Endeavor Agreement with the Jefferson Parish Sheriff’s Office for the purpose of participating in a Criminal Intelligence Center operated by JPSO in Jefferson Parish.
- Ordinance Number: 33306
- Votes Summary:
    Vote 1: Continued to the meeting of 6/3/21
- Decision/Key Actions: The ordinance was continued to the meeting of 6/3/21
- Tags/Keywords: Cooperative Endeavor Agreement, JPSO, Criminal Intelligence Center, Jefferson Parish
- UID: 19b9c830-d20d-4c79-ac06-be44885c677b

- Summary: The ordinance seeks to amend City Council Rule 10 regarding the Consent Agenda and its procedures.

- Topic: Resolution for Levy of Ad Valorem Taxes
- Summary: The ordinance announces the City Council's intention to consider the adoption of a resolution authorizing the calling of an election for the levy of ad valorem taxes.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-171
- Votes Summary:

- Topic: French Quarter Economic Development District Election Results
- Summary: The motion M-21-172 pertained to tabulating the votes cast for and against the FRENCH QUARTER ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT DISTRICT in the Election held on Saturday, April 24, 2021. There were 506 votes for and 194 votes against, with a total of 700 votes cast. The majority of votes were in favor of the district.
- Ordinance Number: M-21-172
